metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41991 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The in-memory certificate cache in strongSwan before 5.9.4 has a remote integer overflow upon receiving many requests with different certificates to fill the cache and later trigger the replacement of cache entries. The code attempts to select a less-often-used cache entry by means of a random number generator, but this is not done correctly. Remote code execution might be a slight possibility.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
charon-systemd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
libstrongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-charon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-libcharon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-nm - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-pki - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-scepclient - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-starter - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-swanctl - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-tnc-base - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-tnc-client - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
strongswan-tnc-server - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.2-1ubuntu2.7').
